message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper is about action recognition using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) on skeleton sequences. The paper proposes a novel two-branch attention architecture to focus on informative joints and spatio-temporal key stages. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a redesign of the skeleton representations to enhance the semantic meaning and preserve structural information, which suggests that it may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper also evaluates its proposed method on two datasets, which suggests that it may belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the use of neural networks suggests that it may also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
